Detection of processes or command-line a.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 7036
Detection of processes or command-line a.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creations containing 'net stop', 'sc stop', or 'taskkill' targeting known service executable names. Use correlation analysis to link these process creations to prior suspicious activity on the host. Use frequency analysis to identify unusual occurrences of these commands on specific hosts.

Modification of service configuration (e.Data: Windows Event ID 4657, Windows Event ID 7040
Modification of service configuration (e.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4657 and 7040 for changes to the 'Start' value or 'StartType' value in the HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services registry hive. Filter for critical services. Correlate configuration changes with user activity logs (Event ID 4624/4625) and patch management records. Identify changes that occur outside scheduled maintenance windows or from unusual user accounts.
